showerReviews.reviewText:
The dirtiest swimming pool in Canberra, with the worst customer service. You find wristbands everywhere, the toilets are dirty all the time, and many of the male-shower sensors don‚Äôt work. I raised this with reception, and they showed the worst attitude, acting like I was lying. They don‚Äôt even bother to say ‚Äúhi‚Äù sometimes, someone should teach them how to smile!
Some of the showers don‚Äôt even have a shower head, and the water is either freezing cold or extremely hot. The change rooms and showers need hourly cleaning, and the Jacuzzi/steamroom temperature should be much higher than it is now. As always, they seem to care only about money, and it takes ages for them to fix even simple issues like the shower sensors.

I‚Äôm writing this in advance: instead of replying with a generic ‚Äúsorry about your experience bla bla,‚Äù take responsibility, fix the issues mentioned, and show some respect to your customers, and smile! If you don‚Äôt like this job, don‚Äôt do it, but if you are doing it, do it properly, and smile!
showerReviews.author: Rom Am

showerReviews.reviewText:
Afternoon swim!
Enjoyed a lovely swim with the family today at the Canberra International Sports and Aquatic Centre. A great swim with a slide for the kids, whirlpool, spa, sauna, and lap pools for me, we loved it all. The condition of all equipment, including showers were great considering other simular centres. My only concern with this pool is the humidity inside, its good to be warm but can feel dehydrating, bring water to hydrate. As a family we love swimming and i would recommend to any family. Follow-up to this review still a great place to swim, got a bit busy today and felt like you had no space for yourself. Further follow-up, pool much the same bit of a bother that no lap pools are heated.
showerReviews.author: Paul Zomer

Im at the pool now and it‚Äôs very sad. I‚Äôm a pensioner and each week is a struggle yet entry for this pool with my discount was $10!!!! That‚Äôs as much as I can afford to spend on food in a day.

I was using the exercise lane cause  I‚Äôm a fall hazzard and I want to enjoy my hydro, but not long after I arrived all the pool lanes except three swimming only lanes in the cold pool closed. For kids swimming classes. And less than 20 kids showed up, one of which puked in the pool.

It‚Äôs not safe for a mobility disabled person to swim here. They don‚Äôt always have a safe lane to be in, and will force you with swimmers, kids or into the stairwell all of which feels demeaning and dehumanising. Can‚Äôt a disabled person be allowed Acess to an appropriate lane as much as the kids and swimmers has access and support.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited on a Sunday with a bunch of kids celebrating a birthday and paid full entry fee.

Wasn't informed that a private scuba school had booked the outdoor pool for 2 hours in the middle of the day resulting in everyone having to relocate to the lap lanes if they wished to continue swimming.

After speaking to the staff was informed that they post availability on their website. This was not correct. Only lap lanes information is posted and even this information was out of date.
Was informed that staff should have informed us of the booking too which also did not happen.
Nothing was offered by way of compensation for the inconvenience, just shrugs by the staff (they were polite and I acknowledge it's not their fault).

Normally I wouldn't have even bothered to leave a review but the level of disregard from staff and the dirty looks from the lap swimmers has left me disappointed and frustrated at the lack of communication.

I'd seriously reconsider visiting this pool as you can't guarantee your fee covers free access to all the facilities and closures will be communicated.

Would not recommend.
showerReviews.author: Mike A

Lastly my son does his class in the middle lane and for him to get out it‚Äôs hard as he is a big boy and I can‚Äôt pull him out because of my back injury. showerReviews.reviewText:
Hello,

I m writing this review to express my dissatisfaction in regards to the swimming lessons.

For multiple reasons I can say that I m not happy with the GoSwim sessions at LakesideLeisure centre Tuggeranong but mainly, because I have not seen my kids improving for so long, feedback o teacher doesn't help.

I have requested for cancelling the classes and removing my kids but, this is just not right.

The teachers are perhaps overworked and have too many kids and they are not able to help every kid.

My daughter doesn't go with right breathing because noone is watching and telling her on what to improve.

Right now, Wednesday, 05.10.2025, 6pm SEAL session,
10kids for one teacher. And the next lane with a teacher is just looking rather than sharing load.

Totally ratio doesn't match.

So, I would urge parents to look for better.

Thanks

showerReviews.reviewText: Swimming lesson was cancelled today. We were not informed of the cancellation. 5 minutes into the lesson a teacher hadn't shown up, so I questioned a staff member who was standing nearby. He told us the lessons had been cancelled but reception hadn't got around to calling everyone yet. No one at reception told us the lesson was cancelled when we came into the pool, the pool was set up with signs as if the lesson was going ahead. Very disappointed with the communication. The staff member then walked away, ignoring the other two families waiting for the lesson, so I had to tell them the lesson was cancelled.

The staff member then walked away, ignoring the other two families waiting for the lesson, so I had to tell them the lesson was cancelled.
showerReviews.author: Ben C

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would like to share my concerns regarding my recent experience with my son‚Äôs swimming lessons.

I attempted to suspend his classes for 6 weeks through the Active World app, but unfortunately, it seems the suspension did not go through, and I was still charged. This was very frustrating as I was under the impression that the request had been successfully submitted. On top of that, his swimming lessons were frequently cancelled, often with very late notice. This has made it extremely difficult to plan around and has been very disappointing for both myself and my son. To make matters worse, the staff at the reception area do not make any effort to help when issues are raised, which only adds to the frustration. Because of these ongoing issues, I have now decided to cancel our membership and enrol elsewhere. Sadly, I cannot recommend this place and would advise others to stay away.
showerReviews.author: Ron Michael Batario

showerReviews.reviewText: My first visit to this facility from Mid North Coast NSW. I really enjoyed my swim in spite of trepidation (unfamiliarity, difficulty with walking, unaccompanied). Assistance with directions given at reception desk. Toilet in entry foyer separate. Plenty of change room options and access, showers beside the pool to rinse off. Chairs to leave belongings in view.  Entry to the 50m pool easy, and shared lane with one swimmer only late morning. Lanes designated by ability.  Water temperature 27 deg C and clean.  Change room showers timed, allowing for soap up then warm rinse off. Exit to the caf√© for refreshments before returning to free parking.  Easily managed despite disability.

showerReviews.reviewText: Really like this pool and the people who use it are friendly and welcoming. But the facilities are often disturbingly dirty - the tiled concourse looks dirty, the tiles in the pool at each end are coated in peoples body grease (how hard is it to give it a scrub ALC?) and I‚Äôm sure the showers aren‚Äôt cleaned from one day to the next. I‚Äôve often found the same clumps of long hair stuck to the walls and drain in the showers are still there the next day.  Same with small pieces of paper, yellow wrist bands etc The floors in the change room area look muddy, especially around the drains. Seriously, a floor scrubber or a steam clean would easily take care of this. I swim at other pools in the region, and this one feels especially unloved and grimy. Other pools seem to have staff constantly cleaning things whether it‚Äôs with a squeegee to dry the floors or a floor scrubbing machine, or just cleaning the windows. And if you look up as you swim, literally sheets of paint hang down from the steel beams - as though the peeling paint will fall into the pool. Guess that‚Äôs just poor workmanship though. The upsides are the warm water, the staff testing water quality frequently, the friendly people who swim there‚Ä¶there‚Äôs lots to commend, but overall the hygiene of the place feels super suspect, and it wouldn‚Äôt be that difficult to remedy.
showerReviews.author: Lucy LaStiq

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been training with Aequus Movement for 4 years now, and I can honestly say it has been life-changing. When I first started at the gym, I was diagnosed with severe arthritis in my knees and had chronic pain. I was even advised to stop lifting weights and just focus on swimming or biking. However, the trainers at Aequus completely turned things around for me. They took the time to assess my movement patterns and helped me correct them, ensuring I was performing exercises with the right technique. As a result, I'm now able to lift weights safely, target the correct muscle groups, and, most importantly, I no longer experience knee pain. The community at Aequus is also incredibly supportive and welcoming, making every session enjoyable. I highly recommend Aequus Movement to anyone looking for expert training and a supportive fitness community!
showerReviews.author: Christie Baran

locations.street: ÓÉàCanberra International Sports and Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been member for a few years to this club, and I really enjoyed the gym and the swimming pool, steam and spa.
But now it‚Äôs getting bad, working on the toilets for ever, dirty, and the worst part is they are so short of staff that nothing is working properly.
After working out for 1.5 hours I decided to go and get spa done, so, no toilet.
I went to front desk to get the bracelet to access the swimming pool.
Only one staff is serving, opening an account.
I asked her if she could just give me the bracelet to get inside (I was busting for the toilet)
She said, she was busy, but the client was just writing his details.
She chose not to give me the bracelet.
When in only a few seconds I could go to the bathroom.
Instead I had to wait for the new client to finish the forms and for her to explain everything to actually get inside.
Today I got a call and after explaining my case I was given a warning by Rebecca.
If you don‚Äôt have staff member maybe is time to get more.
How is possible that one staff member who is just standing there waiting for a form, couldn‚Äôt just let you in?
When the computer right next to is available?
I don‚Äôt understand that.
showerReviews.author: cecilia palma

showerReviews.reviewText:
I hope the review below helps CISAC become a better place, so the community, particularly the people of Belconnen, can enjoy it more:

Gym Review:
Always crowded and filthy. If there‚Äôs a fault with any equipment, don‚Äôt expect it to be fixed anytime soon ‚Äî they might get around to it next year, even if it would only cost them $1! For example, the water dispenser in the middle area has been broken for ages, and they still haven‚Äôt bothered to fix it. Considering the high membership fees they charge, the level of care they show to customers is zero. They only care about charging people as much as possible, with no flexibility when you actually need help.

Swimming Pool Review:
Perhaps the dirtiest swimming pool in Canberra. The change rooms are filthy, the toilets are filthy, and wristbands are left scattered everywhere. Unlike other swimming pools in Canberra, there is no regular cleaning. For a swimming pool, someone should be cleaning the change rooms every hour ‚Äî not just once a day!

Conclusion:
ZERO customer care. Money is all they care about. If you're even $1 behind on a payment, they'll come after you immediately ‚Äî but when it comes to fixing broken equipment or cleaning the place, you‚Äôll be waiting forever.
showerReviews.author: Rom Am

showerReviews.reviewText:
PROS:
- This place is a decent price for membership (~$25 a week) and the staff are very nice and friendly
- It's quiet most of the time, except school holidays when the hotel is extra busy (I presume) so no dealing with gym muppets
- towels provided, and plenty of them
- free fruit (sometimes)
- The pool is a nice bright space in the daytime
- plenty of parking (usually)

CONS:
- The place is focused on hotel guests and as a member, they aren't too fussed about you (took me about 3 goes to get a week trial pass)
- The place is looking a bit rough around the edges, bulbs are out and not replaced etc. The sauna is a bit dark these days...
- showers regularly run cold, especially when busy
- Pool can get very busy during school holidays, but generally ok
- Pool is nice but short (15 m ) if you're focused on swimming
- lockers regularly do not work (electronic lock) and one time my stuff got locked inside one (it was rescued by the staff)
- No cold plunge :(
- Some users seem to think it's their own personal gym, with clothes left out, hung up, generally in the way, rather than in lockers
- Feels a bit old and run down, to be honest
- Always seems to be towels all over the place, but reckon that's partly due to some people not managing to get their towel to the bin provided...
showerReviews.author: David Mole

locations.title: Garden City Hotel, BW Signature Collection

showerReviews.reviewText:
We enjoyed our recent two-night stay at the Best Western in Canberra. As a base for a short trip, it offered great value for money and a quiet, comfortable experience.

The room was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable, ensuring a great night's sleep both nights. We were particularly impressed with the friendly and helpful staff at the front desk, who made check-in and check-out smooth and efficient.

The location is convenient, particularly with the free on-site parking, and it's just a short drive to the Parliamentary Triangle and the shops and restaurants in Manuka and Kingston.

While the bathroom felt a little dated, everything worked perfectly, and the shower pressure was excellent. Overall, this hotel is a solid choice for those visiting Canberra who prioritize comfort, cleanliness, and great value outside of the busy CBD.
showerReviews.author: Quang Do

showerReviews.reviewText: Good location close to major attractions like the War Memorial, Royal Mint, and Zoo. The staff were friendly and helpful, which was appreciated. Unfortunately, the park itself feels dated and cramped. Powered sites are small with little room to maneuver even a caravan van. The amenities block is old and tired, with poor lighting over the sinks, missing shower hooks and no seating in the showers, so have to dress while standing and bags end up on the floor in the water. There are quite a few permanent tenants with clutter around some cabins, and no pool or outdoor areas that invite you to sit and relax. For the premium price, it‚Äôs not great value. From what we‚Äôve heard from other travelers, this seems to be common for Canberra‚Äôs caravan parks ‚Äî they don‚Äôt really cater well for caravan tourists.
showerReviews.author: Mark Phelan

locations.title: Alivio Tourist Park Canberra

showerReviews.reviewText:
Alivio Tourist Park, was a decent place overall. The location was a highlight, fantastic, and accessible to Canberra for visitation desires. I stayed in a double room cabin, which was also well kept for the most part. A few things are to be mentioned however. The room itself had all windows open upon arrival on a 35 degree day, it was completely sweltering, and the bedroom
was inappropriate and frankly
Disgustingly hot to lay down in.

The air con looked very dusty and in need of a service, and honestly only cooled down once the sun set
I do understand, however, that it is hard to maintain cool temperatures in these rooms.

Moreover, the toilet was constantly stuck on flush, which emitted a rather annoying sound. The toilet seat also needed replacing, it looked very old and used. Additionally, the door to
The children room was completely stuck
and not on the hinge, hindering my ability to close it and keep the cool in the lounge area. It was off putting. Otherwise, the room was accompanied by goods such as towels, cloths, plates, a very good industrial setting with perfectly good oven, fridge, stove and microwave. On a side note the air con was very noisy.

The camp site itself was pleasant and kept, and the Pool was also a fantastic facility. I do wish though that the laundry was open a bit later. I wasn't able to clean my clothes after a very busy day, and an early departure for the next day. That all being said, I'd recommend staying here, but would especially recommend it, if those concerns could be remedied.
showerReviews.author: Jack Duncan

Stayed with our caravan for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed.
Check in was easy and quick by friendly staff.
Getting to sites was a bit difficult as they are tightly packed.
The kitchen amenities were excellent and clean except from 1 lazy user.
The location is great for easy access to the numerous activities in Canberra.
We were too busy to experience the other amenities in the park but there seemed numerous activities especially for the kids.
It seems a very busy and popular place so could be noisy in these times as they do pack in a lot in a limited space, but our trip was quiet and relaxing.
Also plenty of friendly Rosella's that come and say high!
showerReviews.author: Garry Morton

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were disappointed as the main experience we came away with was that they wanted to squeeze the most money out of guests - but give the least service with poorly fit out cabins.

In the morning before arrival we rang specifically to ask that our room be ready as soon as possible as we needed to get in quickly to prepare to go out for an event that same day.  However even arriving there just before the advertised check in time of 2pm to try to check in quickly, we were told our cabin wasn't ready even by then!  SO we then had to sit around waiting until finally at 2:30pm they could check us into the room.  Their excuse was it is a big park and takes a long time to clean it all.  So if you know that why not hire enough cleaners to be able to do it all in the 4 hours between 10am check outs and specified 2pm check ins, so guests can check in at the advertised time?  It was especially disappointing as we had specifically called ahead to ask!

When we got to the cabin there was a large bag of dirty laundry and a small bag of rubbish from the bin still sitting on the door step which we had to move away just to get in the door.  The bags sat there for several hours and were finally picked up quite a bit later in the day.
Then trying to make some tea or coffee, there were only a very few of the tiny spoon full packets of long life milk. Not even the normal small Long life milk cartons that most parks have.   Walking back to the office to ask for more milk, please, we were told no they didn't have any.

In the cabin itself we turned on the Air Con (which was very hard to get to turn on and off)  and then set it for the temperature we wanted, but it never adjusted in any way.  It just blew out some air, but never cold enough to actually cool the room on a warm day, no matter the setting.  It was either dodgy, or pre-set to not be able to run strong enough to cool the cabin much.

Other things around the cabin of poor quality, or just missing were for example, the curtains had holes in them and didn't close very well.  The dining table was lopsided and didn't sit flat.  The toilet paper was very thin and there was no box of tissues.  Regarding the bottles for use in the shower, the little bottle of shampoo had actually been mostly used up, probably by a previous guest, but it was still left there with the other two bottles and hadn't been replaced with a new full one!   There was also no information folder of what was available there and what might be around the area?
They were pushing us to sign up for the buffet breakfast and to eat there, but you had to register the night before to get the 'discount' price of $21 (still fairly high for brekkie) or if you didn't pay ahead the price was very much more the next morning.  We didn't bother and when we go back to Canberra, it will be to stay somewhere else!
showerReviews.author: Kris Berr

They were pushing us to sign up for the buffet breakfast and to eat there, but you had to register the night before to get the 'discount' price of $21 (still fairly high for brekkie) or if you didn't pay ahead the price was very much more the next morning.  We didn't bother and when we go back to Canberra, it will be to stay somewhere else!
showerReviews.author: Kris Berr

showerReviews.reviewText:
The park is devoid of any personality. It's very open and we overlooked a recycling yard just unattractive. Being so open the winds howled through with gusts up to 90 plus km hr one day, but around 50 or 60 km hr other days. The wind was relentless through the day but eased off during the night. Apparently September to November can be very windy in Canberra and I wouldn't recommend a visit during these months. ü§∑ The roads in are wide and it's easy to get in and out of the park. We had a drive through site which was easy to get on but if you have a powered site I think the roads are a bit narrow reversing in. The amenities were clean but not enough for the size of the park. A big camp kitchen. There's no pools playgrounds or games rooms.
The park was quiet.
The staff who we only met on our arrival were lovely and helpful.
showerReviews.author: Pamela Rivers

showerReviews.reviewText:
We ended up in Canberra because of a medical emergency that saw a family member in Canberra Hospital in a critical condition.
My sister (and wife of the person in hospital) booked this caravan park for an unknown length of time so that she still had some of ‚Äúher space‚Äù in their caravan.
Let‚Äôs start with the actual park, I‚Äôd rate it 10/10 with excellent concrete slab sites, impeccable ammenities when it comes to cleanliness and location, great camp kitchen and a great location in the city.
The staff, particularly Liz, have gone way above what any business would normally do to help a guest. On hearing of my sister‚Äôs situation, without hesitation under Liz‚Äôs lead they arranged fresh cooked meals, homemade slices, a perfect site location and a feeling of genuine care that‚Äôs often missed. We felt comfortable leaving my sister In Canberra while we returned to Melbourne knowing she was in great care with a network of staff in the park only too happy to assist her in anyway needed.
I can not speak more highly of Liz and the team and would urge anyone staying in Canberra to stay at Discovery - Canberra Park.
showerReviews.author: Steve Murphy

locations.title: Long Stay Caravan park

showerReviews.reviewText:
This complex is one of Canberra's best kept secrets for affordable housing. The complex is owned by HousingACT and has a mix of modern 1,2 and 3 bedroom houses owned and rented by Hosing ACT and older houses owned by residents that can at times be purchased from the owner at the time, rent for these is currently $110 a week which includes sewerage, water, rubbish free ablution blocks, washers and dryers if required by owner. Houses rarely become available as residents dont want to leave.
The complex is located centrally. It is only minutes from Woden, Erindale, Manuka, Fyshwick, and the city. It is a fantastic affordable place to live with great amenities.
Although the name says caravan park, there is no facilities for short term caravan stays.
showerReviews.author: John Stephenson

EPIC Caravan Park is great. The location is just a short drive or light train ride into the city. Good value for $40 per night - power and water.

Lots of events occurred during our stay - e.g. Farmers' Markets on Saturday morning.  McDonald's is within easy walking distance if you need a snack or easy meal.

The cleaning staff do a great job to keep the amenities very clean. Sights can be hit and miss as far as being level, having large mud puddles or trees planted in awkward spots; not insurmountable problems but a little annoying that staff don't rectify or at least consider according to size of van during the placement process.

locations.title: Queanbeyan Riverside Caravan Park - QRCP

showerReviews.reviewText: Not your typical caravan park. There is no personal service here, check in is via your phone. If you don't have phone internet available (I've come across some oldies that don't) this is not for you. The Airstream van at the front is amazing but not sure what purpose it serves. There is a small bbq/eating area, clean amenities/accessible toilets/laundry/kitchen. There is no atmosphere at all and it's quite noticeable - especially as we have stayed in many parks. There is a public walkway on one side where the back of your van is literally a small garden bed from being on the walkway. You have limited privacy and, security is what you provide for yourself. The public just wanders through. There is a great playground for the kids right next door to the park (not inside the park). Shopping centre is right across the road, and there is a park with ducks right next door.  Lots of bindis/spikey things in the grass - ouch! This place really lacked personality and safety. I would only use again for a one nighter and ensure I packed up and locked up. Recommendation to the owner, put a fence around it, put a happy receptionist on - even for a small amount of the day.
showerReviews.author: Cassie Bradley

showerReviews.reviewText: Not your typical caravan park. There is no personal service here, check in is via your phone. If you don't have phone internet available (I've come across some oldies that don't) this is not for you. The Airstream van at the front is amazing but not sure what purpose it serves. There is a small bbq/eating area, clean amenities/accessible toilets/laundry/kitchen. There is no atmosphere at all and it's quite noticeable - especially as we have stayed in many parks. There is a public walkway on one side where the back of your van is literally a small garden bed from being on the walkway. You have limited privacy and, security is what you provide for yourself. The public just wanders through. There is a great playground for the kids right next door to the park (not inside the park). Shopping centre is right across the road, and there is a park with ducks right next door.  Lots of bindis/spikey things in the grass - ouch! This place really lacked personality and safety. I would only use again for a one nighter and ensure I packed up and locked up. Recommendation to the owner, put a fence around it, put a happy receptionist on - even for a small amount of the day.
showerReviews.author: Cassie Bradley

showerReviews.reviewText: This was a good campsite clean amenities hot showers and laundry facilities. Good base for Canberra close to Coles and Kmart and a good Indian restaurant (Punjabi hut) who delivers.The only issue is that there is no fence between the public walking path and sites meaning we didnt chairs etc out at night or while away.
showerReviews.author: Geoff Wallage

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here for a couple nights this week.
The 'riverside' camping spot was directly next to a moderately busy, public walking path. No fence or space between this walking path and the camp spot. I had to park my car next to the walking path and set up the swag behind the car to have some buffer between me and the public walking past.
This wasn't just awkward for me, but visibly awkward for the members of the public who were walking past.
Anyone who is selling a camp spot here should have to spend a night in a tent and see what it is like to try to fall asleep as people walk past not even 2m away. If you are in a caravan I understand it doesn't matter, but in a tent this is socially unacceptable and feels very unsafe.

Thankfully, I was able to change my campspot to a 'park' campspot after the first night.

There was also scabies cream packagaing in the showers and disposed bedding in a shopping trolley next to the bins for the duration of my stay. A bit of a nightmare, but that's just my experience. Beware tent goers!
showerReviews.author: Han

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check in was efficient and easy, all by text and self check in at the gate, which doesn't worry us.
Our site was so small you couldn't put an awning out as the car was right next to the van, there were other sites that were bigger. The ground was just rough gravel and weeds.
Amenities were dated but very clean, with security doors, probably because the park is basically open to the public and anyone can walk through!
This park is convenient for local shops and distance to Canberra, but not as a relaxing holiday spot.
If the rates were less you could understand the lack of atmosphere, but for the nightly rate we were charged you would expect a LOT better.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This park is very open, no fences and public walkway out the back. There is not security and everytime you go out & go to bed you have to put everything away.
We had to pull weeds and grass out so we could put our hose on the tap, not well maintained at all.
The female toilets were disgusting. We arrived on the Tuesday and one cubicle had no toilet paper, now on day 7 and only 1 toilet left that has toilet paper! Toilets have NOT been cleaned for over a week! I called the phone number provided and it took 4 goes for someone to answer, eventually spoke to a very nice lady and was told she would look into it. I said it is a matter of urgency as the toilets are filthy and they will end up with people very sick from the filth, hopefully she will do something.
The site does not have staff to manage on site so unfortunately nothing is done.
The only good thing is it is very close to shops if that is what you‚Äôre into!
We won‚Äôt be back!

locations.title: Rydges Canberra

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing stay

Check-in was straightforward. I didn‚Äôt use the free Wi-Fi, so can‚Äôt comment on that.

Unfortunately, the Executive King Suite itself was very disappointing. The couch was visibly stained and ripped, and there appeared to be food smeared on the carpet (photos provided). The bed sheets were also stained, which we were told were ‚Äúchemical stains from the laundry.‚Äù We called reception simply to report these issues, but housekeeping was sent with a replacement pillow instead , something we hadn‚Äôt requested, so there was clearly some miscommunication. We were told everything was considered ‚Äúnormal,‚Äù and asked if we wanted someone to clean the food off the carpet.

The TV didn‚Äôt work initially but was reset by staff the next day and worked after that.

Despite having a ‚ÄúDo Not Disturb / No Housekeeping‚Äù sign on the door, someone walked into our room at around 8:15am while we were still in bed. We raised this with reception when checking out, but the response was essentially ‚Äúsorry, and have a nice day,‚Äù which felt dismissive given the number of issues.

A further point for awareness (as this may not suit everyone): the shower opening is extremely narrow ‚Äî approximately 450mm wide. We are both small in stature and my husband still had to enter sideways. A shower cap is absolutely necessary, as it‚Äôs nearly impossible to avoid getting your hair wet. Our tiny home shower has more space than this.
The side lamp for bed constantly flickered, so couldn't be used.
The only real positives were that the bed was a proper king (no join in the middle) and it was comfortable. The pillows were all different heights, though we had brought our own.

Overall, a very disappointing experience and not what we expected from Rydges as we have stayed at the previous venues which had been a positive experience (Hunter Valley and Newcastle).
showerReviews.author: Donna Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Basic showground camping. Pretty good amenities.

Reason I gave it 5 stars is the location.  Straight out the gate is the light rail. Takes you straight into the city interchange from where you can easily catch a bus to everywhere.

Free transport from 0900 to 1630 and then 1800 for anyone with a seniors card under the age of 70 yrs.

70 yrs and older free anytime.

The gate for tram to camping is a short walk or you can drive within showground and leave your car at the gate.

Its currently cold so that's what we have done.

Cant beat the location.

We saw many birds and even a kangaroo.

Beautiful spot nice and close to Canberra. This would be a bird watchers or a mountain bikers dream.

We stayed for two nights. The kids said it was their favourite spot. It has a beautiful creek and trees and rope swings and sand banks.

The caravan sites are all close together but they do have tables and fire pits (bring your own wood)  the tent sites  are beautiful too.

Hot showers, clean toilets and drinking water. Taps at caravan sites too!

Well done ACT national parks!

locations.title: Cottermouth

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed with a school group of 20 in July 2025. Organising the stay was easy and communication was great. Onsite staff were very helpful and accommodating, to ensure the group had the best stay possible. Meals were enjoyed by the group of teenagers; and the option to make our own lunch rolls was welcome. Facilities are in good nick and there's a coffee machine for staff! The only downside was that in a dorm of 10 students, there was just the one shower and one toilet. That said - our group had a really enjoyable experience at Camp Cottermouth and I'd definitely recommend it for other school groups visiting Canberra.
showerReviews.author: Anthony Ritchie

locations.title: Woods Reserve

showerReviews.reviewText:
Sensational experience, family friendly spot with ample amenities, proper toilets, showers with hot water, bbq and very smooth drive and parking area. The highlight is the walk up to the waterfall and the small to medium pools to chillax, the water is very cold but worth a dip. Very picturesque walks at any time but if you are an early riser (especially winters), you are in for a feast for your senses.
P.s. You don't really need a 4WD, not even if you have to go slightly off the road, as the ground around is solid and it doesn't get overly muddy when wet. I was in a low coupe and had no issues.
showerReviews.author: Shah Asghari

showerReviews.reviewText: A great spot between the nature reserve and the national park, right beside Gibraltar Creek. Perfect for a quiet stay in nature, getting up close to birds and kangaroos. Only two sites are really suitable for camper trailers and small caravans at the top. If you go too far turning can be tricky. Bookings are online and very reasonable. Woos Reserve is not far from the southern parts of Canberra. There are two clean amenities blocks, one with 3 minute timed hot showers. There are also a couple of walks starting at the campground and plenty of bbqs and picnic tables.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Morice

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great base for exploring Tidbinbilla, nearby Gibraltar Falls and the further-afield Namadgi National Park. A ranger comes by to check on campers, so make sure you have a legit booking.

Campground has toilets (incl. toilet paper), fire pits, communal covered BBQs, showers and wash-up areas.
Bring own firewood, kindling, etc.

It‚Äôs not the ‚Äúprettiest‚Äù campground ‚Äì the creek isn‚Äôt within view of your campsite, and you‚Äôre ensconced in a small valley with not much to look at except trees and other cars.
But the facilities are good, and the creek is just a short walk away when you fancy a dip in the cold water.

You can also tackle the 40-60min uphill slog to Gibraltar Falls, or get in your car and drive up to the falls (or other sites/walks, as we did).
showerReviews.author: Nataniel Kraizelburd

showerReviews.reviewText:
Truly an amazing place to camp, it's perfect for every level of camping experience. The flushing toilets and warm showers provide a bit more comfort in the bush.
Watch the stars and satellites overhead at night.
This place has grown with popularity and the holiday seasons really do fill up fast. Access to the waterfront is allowed for all campers regardless of whether you consider it your own claim, so placing your aggressive dog at the edge where it bites everyone passing is not advisable, SIC of blue heeler attached to marquee. You will also need to take your rubbish out with you as bins are no longer provided.
showerReviews.author: Steve Coatez

There is a reason this place is the cheapest in Perth! Managment is very poor. They have rooms for addicts and dv cases and one of them stole my property from the camp kitchen.

Take plenty of mossie repelent in spring and summer as there is  a drain and a small river  close by the mossies will take small children away lol.
Its  not actually in the swan valley!

The only good thing about this place was the lovely ladies in reception!
Head to another park is my advice!üòÄüëå

locations.title: Busselton Villas & Glamping Village

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed 3 nights in a two bedroom villa no. 2 with husband and 2 children

Positives - friendly and welcoming reception lady, smart TV, shower pressure, the place was clean, games room, playground, access to the beach, great location as a base with nearby shops

Negatives - costly considering the quality of the accommodation and considering there is mould... strong mould smell was coming from the kitchen cupboard where crockery is kept so had to keep washing plates before using them as wasn't taking our chances, in the end kept the crockery outside, mould smell also in the bedroom wardrobe so became unusable as didn't want clothes to smell, mould smell in the bathroom with very noisy fan extractor(needs maintenance), the whole place is very outdated with exposed brick on the walls, the 2 bedroom villas are next to the highway so if you are noise sensitive you will hear the cars at night

Overall, would not recommend due to the above mentioned negatives.
showerReviews.author: Ingrid Morris

showerReviews.reviewText:
What started off as a hopeful stay turned quite quickly.

My wife and child went to use the shower, and the entire shower arm snapped off, spraying water in their faces.

I immediately went to the concierge to speak with someone, and after waiting a hot minute, a man finally came from behind closed doors. I explained the issue, and he opened a door to rummage through old, broken items before emerging with another faulty shower head. He told me I‚Äôd have to wait a day or two for a proper fix, but since I was only staying one night, that wasn‚Äôt an option.
He said I could try replacing it myself, which I did with tools I had in my car, just so my family could have a shower after a long day of traveling.

The lack of urgency or concern from the staff was appalling. Additionally, the privacy situation was a huge issue‚Äîthe curtains in our room wouldn‚Äôt close completely, meaning anyone could easily see in which made it extremely uncomfortable for my breastfeeding wife

For over $200 for one night, I expected much better. The lack of professionalism, attention to basic needs, and the poor condition of the room made this experience incredibly disappointing. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
showerReviews.author: H B

locations.title: Original Backpackers Hostel Sydney Australia
locations.address: ÓÉà162 Victoria Street, Potts Point NSW 2011

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are two Canadians, stayed for 10 nights as we got settled for our working holiday in Australia. Leo at reception was a massive help in assisting us with extending our stay, thanks Leo!! The staff are all so helpful and friendly, shoutout to Lune and Henry as well.

Rooms:
First we stayed in a 6-bed dorm which was good, your typical dorm room. Bottom bunks have curtains, top bunks have access to the tops of the lockers to set your things, and there is a fan and mini fridge. We extended our stay and moved to a private + ensuite. The room was great, with a fan, mini fridge, and TV. We extended again and moved to a private with no ensuite, which still had the fan, fridge, and TV.

Bathrooms:
Showers and bathrooms are often busy but there are lots around the hostel, so something will usually be available. With high traffic they can sometimes get dirty, as with most hostels. The staff are visibly working hard to clean every day, and they stay on top of it. Towels are provided!

Kitchen:
Breakfast is provided every day from 8am to 10am (toast, peanut butter, jam, marmalade, butter, vegemite, and some cereal options with milk), and dinner is provided on Tues/Thurs/Sat at 8pm. Dinner rotates between pasta, rice/veggies, and BBQ. Thank you to Dave for cooking!

The kitchen is closed every day at 10am for about an hour so staff can clean, so be aware when you‚Äôre planning breakfast.

Staff are very good and making sure people leave the courtyard by 10pm so it‚Äôs quiet near the rooms. People usually move to the TV room or front porch to hang out past 10.

They offer daily activities on their WhatsApp channel, such as city walks, picnics, pub trivia, and basketball at a local outdoor court.

We will definitely stay here again!
showerReviews.author: Sara McEwan

locations.title: Australian Institute of Sport

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôd like to raise a concern regarding the ongoing parking issues at the centre, particularly when events or competitions are held.

I fully understand that occasional competitions are important and can attract large numbers of participants and visitors. However, it‚Äôs becoming increasingly difficult for regular attendees‚Äîespecially parents like myself with young children enrolled in swimming lessons‚Äîto find parking during these times. Today‚Äôs experience was particularly frustrating, as I was unable to find a spot despite arriving early, and this almost led to missing our class.

What‚Äôs even more disappointing is that while the centre has a strict policy against last-minute cancellations or deferrals, there is no flexibility when circumstances like this‚Äîbeyond our control‚Äîprevent attendance. I would be more than happy to defer the class to the following week if parking is not available, rather than being penalised for something that‚Äôs clearly a logistical issue.

I believe a more organised approach is needed during event days to ensure that regular class attendees are not disadvantaged. Perhaps allocating a portion of the car park for lesson participants or providing prior notification and alternate solutions could be considered.

I‚Äôm also curious to know if other parents have raised similar concerns and how they‚Äôve managed in these situations.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this feedback. I hope a more balanced solution can be implemented moving forward.
showerReviews.author: Erlin Johannes

Customer service, lessons and facilities have gone downhill exponentially!! On the other hand fees have gone up exponentially too!!
Half of the time showers are not working, when is not the men‚Äôs, it‚Äôs women‚Äôs or the parents showers. Temperature in the showers is inconsistent at best and there are only 2 showers for the whole complex!! And let‚Äôs not talk about cleanliness, I‚Äôm surprised nobody Cisac has not been fined. Most of the showers have mold and the shower curtains are disgusting!
And let‚Äôs not forget about being charged to use the water slide which is so unsafe as the stairs are wet and slippery and you guessed it, there is also mold.
There is nobody to talk to or complain and whenever there is someone the response you get is ‚Äúyeah, we know about it‚Äù

showerReviews.reviewText:
Signed my 1 year old up to swim school today. Wasn't told where I was suppose to go or What I was suppose to do. After asking what floaties i should buy i was told " i dont know, noone actually works in tye shop". I dont even know what the hell that was suppose to mean?!! Finally found out after 30 mins of wondering around where I was suppose to go. Once the lesson was over i found the only facility to shower my little one was in the "parent room". Which is, put simply- a toilet and a shower. There are no benches for bags, no hooks for clothes, no change table in the same room etc nothing. Just a wet floor and a toilet (which I had to constantly keep my son away from because it was disgusting).

This was my very first experience taking my son to swimming lessons. Once I left,I phoned in and cancelled immediately. Extremely disappointing.
showerReviews.author: David Bossman

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been using this gym for a couple of years now. It is certainly one of the better AF gyms in Canberra - small, boutique with the right sort of clientele (older less image conscious folks!).

One irritation is that it clearly states on the walls in the gym and on many machines that the clients need to use both towels and wipe down the equipment after - I have addressed this with the staff twice in the past 2 weeks and they say "Yes it is policy" all the whilst clients are in the gym with no towel, no wiping anything down and with Winter on the way this is a great way of spreading infections.

This has been a deterioration in the quality of this gym - which is a shame as it has a good feel about it.
showerReviews.author: Adrian Faccioni

I‚Äôll be back in August so will see you again soon.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had dinner here on Sunday and the food was excellent, but the overall experience was let down by the service.
Communication was difficult as several staff had very limited English, which made ordering slow and led to multiple mistakes.

The venue itself could really benefit from some investment and updating.
The bar equipment looks tired, the fridge lights flicker constantly, and a modern glass washer would make a big difference to hygiene and presentation.
At the moment, most glasses come out with noticeable water droplets, which is off-putting for guests who expect clean, dry glassware.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room was a nice size but had no opening windows. It was hot when we arrived but with  the air conditioning turned on it was bloody cold, no matter what temperature it was set at. The lazy room cleaners who were all standing outside talking doing nothing when we went out for the day made the bed but did not change the towels, just left them on the bathroom floor, nor did they empty the bins one of which was full. The room had also not been dusted for quite a few days.  When I complained to the front desk as we left the next morning the attitude of what I think was the manager was that he couldn‚Äôt really care less. He said that we had probably left the do not disturb light on. I pointed out if that was the case, which it wasn‚Äôt, why did they go in and make the bed? He then simply said ,
Unconvincingly, ‚Äúwe will try and do better‚Äù. I felt very disappointed as we stay at a large number of hotels and rarely see such a disingenuous person at the front desk. We have also stayed at quite a few Accor hotels.  Also, when checking in we were told we needed to pay $15 a night to park in the car park as it wasn‚Äôt safe to leave a car outside. We found out whilst eating out that night that there was a free, perfectly safe, car park 50 meters away, and that street parking in that area was safe. It appears based on what we were told by others we were lied to so they could charge an extra fee. I intend complaining to head office about this. In upshot we paid for a service we didn‚Äôt get and were charged for something we didn‚Äôt need. Not a great portrayal for this hotel.
I very much doubt they will respond to this review as having now looked at their reviews Incan see they respond to positive comments but not ones where the service has been poor. I also saw another review that also mentioned poor cleaning standards and a lack of concern by the front desk when mentioned.
showerReviews.author: Adrian Daniels

The lazy room cleaners who were all standing outside talking doing nothing when we went out for the day made the bed but did not change the towels, just left them on the bathroom floor, nor did they empty the bins one of which was full. The room had also not been dusted for quite a few days.  When I complained to the front desk as we left the next morning the attitude of what I think was the manager was that he couldn‚Äôt really care less. He said that we had probably left the do not disturb light on. I pointed out if that was the case, which it wasn‚Äôt, why did they go in and make the bed? He then simply said ,
Unconvincingly, ‚Äúwe will try and do better‚Äù. I felt very disappointed as we stay at a large number of hotels and rarely see such a disingenuous person at the front desk. We have also stayed at quite a few Accor hotels.  Also, when checking in we were told we needed to pay $15 a night to park in the car park as it wasn‚Äôt safe to leave a car outside. We found out whilst eating out that night that there was a free, perfectly safe, car park 50 meters away, and that street parking in that area was safe. It appears based on what we were told by others we were lied to so they could charge an extra fee. I intend complaining to head office about this. In upshot we paid for a service we didn‚Äôt get and were charged for something we didn‚Äôt need. Not a great portrayal for this hotel.
I very much doubt they will respond to this review as having now looked at their reviews Incan see they respond to positive comments but not ones where the service has been poor. I also saw another review that also mentioned poor cleaning standards and a lack of concern by the front desk when mentioned.
showerReviews.author: Adrian Daniels

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at the abode hotel. The location is excellent with the Woolworths Metro opposite the front doors. There is also a restaurant on the ground floor which does room service. The food from room service was also excellent. All of the staff were very helpful and happy to assist with anything we require required.
Accessibility issues were the lift says it is on the fourth floor when it is on the third floor. It also says it is on the fourth floor when it is on the fourth floor. As someone with low vision I had trouble working out the difference.
The second accessibility issue was in the room, the bathroom is not on the same level as the rest of the room and has black tiles. The tiles that go down to the passage I want a slight angle and the carpet is also black. There is no contrast so that you can see there is a step.
The bathroom is well laid out as is the bedroom with a cupboard and PowerPoint next to each side of the bed.
The dining lounge and Kitchener area were a good size and there is a washing machine/dryer in the Kitchener area as well.
We were very happy with the accommodation as I was staying with someone else they were able to help me with the lift and they were able to tell me about the step in the bathroom.

locations.title: Pavilion on Northbourne Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not the best hotel we have ever stayed at but we are regular guests here! For the price, location and amenities we need and how often we have to stay in Canberra it works great for my family.
It's not the newest fanciest nicest place but the staff are always really helpful and friendly, we love the plants everywhere and always seem to have the pool to ourselves, my child LOVES looking at the indoor fish ponds.
It is annoying that you have to walk through the restaurant to get to the pool but you can also get to it through the car park but I don't want to walk my young child through the cars.
It's always clean (for an older hotel that is hard to keep spotless) and the location in the city is very convinient but the loud traffic at night makes it a bit difficult for light sleepers. Bed is moderately comfortable. Buffett breakfast is always great!
Having dinner at the restaurant is good, yummy and great service (portion sizes a bit small for the price) but room services ü§¢ yuck! everytime we have ordered it is gross so we avoid that now. The free parking is really convenient.
Overall we think value for money makes this a great affordable comfortable stay üòÅ
showerReviews.author: Natalie Turnbull

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê Extremely Disappointing Stay

My company booked me here for a business trip, and unfortunately the experience was awful from start to finish. I checked in at 6 pm on 19/11 and was planning for a simple overnight stay. Before going to bed, I went to take a shower, but as soon as I turned on the water, the hot water knob fell off, followed immediately by the cold water knob. I had to stop my shower and get out because it was impossible to continue. Accidents happen, so I didn‚Äôt make a big deal of it at the time.

However, the next morning brought another surprise: the toilet flush didn‚Äôt work at all because no water was filling the tank. I had to go down to the lobby just to use the bathroom.

At checkout, I showed the reception staff the broken shower knobs and informed them about the toilet issue. Not even an apology just a completely indifferent response.

Overall, a horrible experience. Poor maintenance, no customer service, and a stay I would not wish on anyone.
showerReviews.author: Amir Bijani

locations.title: Belconnen Way Hotel & Serviced Apartments

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm a full time wheelchair user so we booked Room 3 which is a 2 bedroom + 1 bathroom accessible room.

POSITIVES
-good location
-the kitchenette (it is not wheelchair accessible but it was convenient for my family to use)
-bedroom & bathroom size

NEGATIVES
-the unserviced aspect is NOT clearly communicated. The fact that the doors have a do not disturb sign implies that if you don't put that out your room will be serviced. (Particularly since the name of the place includes the word SERVICED.
-the meals/lounge area is small & overcrowded with oversized furniture. Not great for a wheelchair user.
-it is not obvious until you arrive that you have to go through one of the bedrooms to get to the bathroom. That made for a very uncomfortable situation.
-there are no shelves in the bathroom to put your toiletries on. So you either have to put them on the floor or take them to & from your room every time you want to use them.
-there aren't an adequate amount of towel rails particularly considering how many people the unit can accommodate.
-there are insufficient grab rails.
-the wash basin is too low so I consistently hit my knees when using it.
-the shower floor is not graded properly which means water goes everywhere. Not at all safe, and we had to use endless towels to mop up the water so no one slipped.
-the bathroom amenities are individual items. In this day & age most motels/hotels use refillable bottles which are more environmentally friendly.
-the shower taps have been installed incorrectly.
-the wash basin doesn't drain properly & obviously hasn't for quite sometime. This makes me think housekeeping needs to be more attentive.
-the mattresses were very uncomfortable. There were also no spare pillows. I guess we could have asked for them, but that seems like one of those things that should just be standard.

We stay in approximately 20 places per year, this is one of the worst accessible bathrooms I have come across. It does not appear that professional advice was sought, instead it was a box ticking exercise where someone said, hey we put in a couple of grab rails so now it's accessible.

I hope you will consider doing better.
showerReviews.author: Rachael Thorpe

showerReviews.reviewText:
These are NOT serviced rooms. If you are staying for 1 or 2 nights this is fine. Not so great when you booked for 10 days. When you arrive you receive a leaflet with information that the rooms are not serviced daily and you have to ask if there is any thing you need.

We arrived on a Saturday. We booked and stayed for 10 days and the rooms were not serviced once. So not vacuumed, no bin emptied, nothing. There was no option to hang something on the door asking for the room to be serviced either.
We booked a classical room with a double and single bed as my partner snores quite loudly so it's easier to sleep in separate beds. The double sagged badly (see photo). We asked on Sunday if we could could change rooms because of the bed and were shown other rooms with beds that also sagged.
The fridge was behind the door to the apartment inside a cupboard with sliding doors, so most times you opened the door it tended to hit the mirrored doors. Luckily the mirror didn't break.
There were no power points near the main bed in any of the rooms we were shown, which is a problem when you rely on cpap. We opted on Sunday to stay where we were as nothing we'd been shown was better than what we had.

There was a side table with one shelf. We discovered that it didn't have all it's pegs to support it when I put something on the shelf and it promptly slid to the back and fell down to the bottom shelf.

On Monday the staff said we could change to a better room as they were not busy, and we were staying another week.

We were given a 2 bedroom unit that could sleep up to 5 at no extra cost. The beds didn't sag and there was power near the main bed in one of the rooms. There was also a bigger fridge. This was great!
However, in the 2 bedroom unit there was no hair-dryer, no teatowels, (although we had a sink with no plug), pots and pans, and a hotplate in the cupboard. Seeing as a fire alarm went off at 6.30am Sunday morning from someone cooking in their room we didn't use any of it.
There was nowhere to hang or store your clothes unless it was in your suitcase or on the only bed not being used. There was shampoo satchets that resisted being torn open in the shower, whereas in the 1st room the shampoo came in a little bottle. I don't understand the inconsistency in room products.
The airconditioning was hit and miss. To get the room above 20¬∞ we had to set the thermostat to 30. At times you would get a bit hot but most times it struggled to heat the room. You could feel the cold coming up through the floor.
I could hear noises and voices coming from other rooms, people in the corridor, doors opening and closing so little to no sound insulation.
The extra blanket supplied had someone else's long hair all over it (we both have short hair) and I didn't feel comfortable using it except on the lower end of the bed. This means that they don't check or clean the blankets after use.

The curtains are wearing through and need to be replaced soon.

The plus side was great wifi, undercover and locked car accommodation. The staff were respectful and courteous when we did talk to them.

Overall, the place is in need of better management, maintenance and asset replacement. We are not planning on staying there again and I wouldn't recommend it. I gave it a 3 only because we were given the larger room. It didn't not live up to the advertisements and "Serviced" should be removed from the name.
showerReviews.author: Cathie Raymond

showerReviews.reviewText:
Treated myself to a remedial massage with coffee and coconut scrub using a voucher. Good check in, and waiting room. I was offered water or tea and had time to drink it. Treatment room was lovely and smelt nice but not overpowering. Nice temperature on a cool Canberra morning. The music did have a crackle which was distracting though!

Treatment was nice. Coffee scrub was ok, but pressure could have been stronger. Lovely shower, with a robe and slippers to wear to the shower and a clean robe and slippers to wear out. Need to top up the soap as it ran out! Lovely massage - probably more relaxing than remedial. But did improve when I asked for stronger pressure. Nice eye mask and use of warm stones, even though it wasn't a hot rock massage. Overall, an extremely pleasant experience and no pressure to buy stuff at all (wasn't even asked) which is extremely refreshing and I'm likely to go back just for that positive experience!

With a large team of highly professional and dedicated instructors, the teaching quality is simply superb. The facilities are excellent, and the absolute best feature is the consistent warmth, even in the depths of winter ‚Äì no more shivering after a swim! showerReviews.reviewText: The sauna here is disgusting.  Not only is it dirty but it smells of bad BO.  I don't believe the sauna has ever been cleaned (I keep seeing the same dirt) nor aired out at the end of the day.  There's a sign that says you need to be clean, have a towel and do not throw water on the coals.  The rules are continually flouted.  The sauna is dominated by males who thinks its their right to come in all sweaty after a workout in their gym outfit and stink up the place with their BO and sweat dripping onto the benches.  What's even worse is the regular patrons would fill their used water bottle with water from the bathroom and throw it onto the coals to generate the steam and humidity.  This is offensive and unhygienic.  No one wants to breathe in someone's spit.  And it's supposed to be a DRY sauna, not a steam room.  The gym here is not at all inclusive and lacks proper management.

The studio is huge, has a proper stage for the instructors and it has a stage lighting that gives life to the place. Their weights and steps are those of Les Mills equipments in the Fitness First Platinum clubs. The other parts of the gym are also spacious. The showers, locker room and toilets are kept clean as well. It has a sauna (but haven't used it due to COVID restrictions). The gym is located near the Deakin shops. If parking is already full in front of Fitness First, you may park your car along Hannah Place, at the back of the gym. It's worth signing up to Fitness First if the clubs are accessible to your location.

locations.title: Abode Woden

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently had a 10 day stay at this hotel. The location is good and close to shops and restaurants.
The room itself was good, just an average room which was clean and tidy.
The service, not so great. Housekeeping only visit your room once every four days which is fine if they actually did a full clean and sheet change. But after returning on day 4 to my room, the sheets weren‚Äôt changed, they simply pulled up the existing sheets and remade the bed. Every two days after that, they replaced the towels but didn‚Äôt always take away some of the dirty ones. On day eight, the sheets weren‚Äôt changed again. This is really unacceptable. Yes it‚Äôs not a five star hotel, but housekeeping should at least change the sheets when they come into your room. Also, the room was particularly hot even though I switched off the air conditioning system in the room, there is still a main system that you can‚Äôt shut off, And it was ridiculously hot. I develop a very dry throat and skin and a cough over the 10 days. When I queried it, they said there was nothing they could do to change It so I remained uncomfortable.
Furthermore, one particular reception worker on the Night Shift was completely unhelpful and his manner lazy. He basically fobbed me off and told me to deal with my problem in the morning with the morning staff which I couldn‚Äôt do because I had very early commit commitments for work.

The staff in the restaurant however, were really nice and cooked a great breakfast too.
I probably wouldn‚Äôt recommend this as a place to stay at nor would I choose to stay there again
showerReviews.author: Thern Reynolds

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently had a 10 day stay at this hotel. The location is good and close to shops and restaurants.
The room itself was good, just an average room which was clean and tidy.
The service, not so great. Housekeeping only visit your room once every four days which is fine if they actually did a full clean and sheet change. But after returning on day 4 to my room, the sheets weren‚Äôt changed, they simply pulled up the existing sheets and remade the bed. Every two days after that, they replaced the towels but didn‚Äôt always take away some of the dirty ones. On day eight, the sheets weren‚Äôt changed again. This is really unacceptable. Yes it‚Äôs not a five star hotel, but housekeeping should at least change the sheets when they come into your room. Also, the room was particularly hot even though I switched off the air conditioning system in the room, there is still a main system that you can‚Äôt shut off, And it was ridiculously hot. I develop a very dry throat and skin and a cough over the 10 days. When I queried it, they said there was nothing they could do to change It so I remained uncomfortable.
Furthermore, one particular reception worker on the Night Shift was completely unhelpful and his manner lazy. He basically fobbed me off and told me to deal with my problem in the morning with the morning staff which I couldn‚Äôt do because I had very early commit commitments for work.

The staff in the restaurant however, were really nice and cooked a great breakfast too.
I probably wouldn‚Äôt recommend this as a place to stay at nor would I choose to stay there again
showerReviews.author: Thern Reynolds

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow what a big caravan park! Very clean and tidy has 2 pools 1 deep the other for the kids .. however this is located at the top of the hill. So if you‚Äôre on the lower level and not good with walking you will have to drive up and try to find a park. Has mini golf, tennis court, jumping pillow.
Has 8 ensuites they do have 2 steps up to get inside.
We had a sight with artificial grass near the lake and jetty‚Äôs ..amazing!!
Has 2 jetties and a boat ramp.
Hugh lake!!!
They also feed the rainbow lorikeets in the afternoons ..so cute! A lot of wildlife including ducks
Down the back they have a nice camp kitchen first one they had 2 slow cookers but no air fryers. Big TV.
Toilet block very clean and nice $4 for washers and dryers has top and front loading machines and 2 dryers in the one near us.
A small play ground it‚Äôs near the bottom part of the lake also.
Has a cafe around the corner about a 5 min walk if that .. closer if yr near the front of the park .
There is also a little news agent and an express shop for yr needs.
Fish off the jetty if u like or on the below section of the bridge.
Walk over the bridge and there is a bakery and a fish and chip shop.
Staff are very friendly and helpful.
They have cabins but not sure on how many but there is quite a few!.
You are not far from Ulladulla at all.
Good first day so far üëçüôÇ

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Busselton

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed Friday through Sunday and had such a great experience. On Friday morning I called to see if our cabin could be ready an hour earlier, and the staff were absolutely lovely about it ‚Äî so polite and friendly over the phone. When we arrived hours earlier than expected, we were fully prepared to wait, but they happily checked us in straight away. Honestly, the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more welcoming or helpful.

The cabin itself was amazing ‚Äî cheap and cheerful, with everything we needed. It had a full-size fridge, four single beds in two bunk sets, and a separate bedroom with a double bed and wardrobe. There was pantry space and an outdoor area which wasn‚Äôt private, but that didn‚Äôt bother us as we weren‚Äôt there much. The only challenge was keeping our two very young kids away from the road out front. A couple of small improvements that would make a big difference would be adding a washer/dryer and a basic vacuum cleaner. With the wet weather we brought in quite a bit of dirt and debris, and I imagine it would be the same with sand in summer.

The heated indoor pool was next level ‚Äî such a huge plus! I really hope Discovery Parks Busselton continues to do well so they can put a bit of money into sprucing up the cabins, but honestly we were stoked with them as they are. We‚Äôll definitely be back in the warmer months! üåû
showerReviews.author: Sinead White

showerReviews.reviewText:
Family of 4 stayed 3 nights in a Superior Safari Tent. A challenge with canvas tents is mould and this tent was definitely showing it. The canvas was covered in mold and dust, as shown in the pictures. We aired the tent throughout the day to help with the dank smell, but the wet area doesn't have any way to create a good cross flow.

The shower drain was blocked up (reported to reception). This was not addressed or fixed during our stay. Despite running the shower on low, water pooled at our feet bringing up the muck, and overflowed into the room. Pictures also show clumps of hair from previous occupants.

The air conditioner kept us warm at night and very cool during the day. Hopefully its filters were clean, as the mould in the tent had us concerned.

The microwave did not heat up at all! We could not reheat or cook our food.

The indoor heated pool was nice & warm however, it too requires some maintenance as there was a lining of dirt & dead bugs surrounding the pool.

Discovery Park itself was quiet & very close to the beach. It  was nice to hear the waves and great central location.

I would not recommend staying in the Safari Tents due to the aged state of the tent and its amenities.
showerReviews.author: Jessica Stephan

locations.title: Little National Hotel Canberra

showerReviews.reviewText:
I rarely leave negative reviews, but my stay at Little National Hotel Canberra has been extremely frustrating and disappointing.

From the moment we checked in, the experience went downhill. On the first night, the TV in our room did not work. Unfortunately, there was no service crew available until the next morning, meaning after long hours of driving we were unable to relax in our room as expected. Not a great way to start a stay.

On the second day, after returning from a full day of exploring Canberra, we encountered another major issue. The parking boom gate was not working and would not open. Reception informed us they were unable to fix it and that we would need to wait until the next morning. We were instructed to park in an open area next to a construction site. When I raised safety concerns regarding potential damage or risks from the construction site, the response was dismissive. I was simply told to remove valuables from the car and that the hotel would take no responsibility. While I understand general liability limitations, the complete lack of concern or reassurance was disappointing.

To make matters worse, when we finally got back to our room hoping to rest, the hot water was not working. Reception advised that the boiler was down and we would need to wait until the next morning for hot water. After a long day, not being able to take a hot shower is unacceptable for a hotel of this standard. Hot water is a basic necessity, not a luxury.

What made the experience even more frustrating was the repeated use of stock responses from reception, with no sense of urgency, ownership, or genuine effort to resolve the issues.

The room itself was fine, but basic services and customer care were severely lacking. Unfortunately, this stay did not meet even the minimum expectations of comfort and service. I would strongly reconsider staying here again and hope management takes these issues seriously.
showerReviews.author: Nisal Livera

showerReviews.reviewText: What a fabulous hotel and concept! The staff here are fantastic and super friendly. No question went unanswered. The ambience was fresh and moody. The scent on arrival into the lobby was stunning. The hotel was clean and tidy. Great amenities and beautiful views. Business or pleasure, this is a gem. Walking distance to bars at nearby hotels and restaurants. The hotel lounge deserves a mention and was a great meeting up spot. If only more hotels were this fantastic.
showerReviews.author: Syl Z

showerReviews.reviewText:
I booked one night here over a weekend/holiday.

In the evening, when I tried to take a shower, I discovered that there was no hot water at all.

I contacted the duty manager and was told that they were unable to resolve the issue and that nothing could be done until the next morning.

After driving all the way from Sydney to Canberra in summer, not even being able to take a basic hot shower is completely unacceptable for a hotel stay.

This has been the worst hotel experience I‚Äôve had in Australia.

I would strongly advise others to think twice before booking this property.
showerReviews.author: Rex

showerReviews.reviewText:
The massage I was given was lovely but the environment  wasn't. It's an open shop frontage, right next to David Jones, so during my massage I constantly heard the background noise of shoppers in the shopping centre so it wasn't that relaxing.

Also, the cubicle was very bare, just the bed. No decor on walls, candles, soft lights, etc to create a relaxing peaceful mood.
